importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article's publication, indicating when this incident was reported to the public.

keyTakeAways: A woman in her 20s in Osan, South Korea, attempted to kill a cockroach using an improvised flamethrower made from a lighter and flammable spray, which resulted in a fire that spread to her apartment building.
The fire led to the death of a Chinese national woman in her 30s who fell from a window during a failed escape attempt due to thick smoke blocking the stairway.
The woman’s husband escaped by climbing to the next block, while she fell from the window and died shortly after being hospitalized.
Eight other residents suffered smoke inhalation from the fire, highlighting the dangers of such uncontrolled fire incidents.
Blasting cockroaches with flamethrowers or improvised devices has become a viral trend, popularized by social media videos, despite known risks.
South Korean police are seeking an arrest warrant for the woman, accusing her of negligence in starting the fire and causing death.
The building contains 32 residential units and commercial shops on the ground floor, increasing the potential for widespread impact.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A woman in her 20s in Osan, South Korea, attempted to kill a cockroach using a homemade flamethrower made from a lighter and flammable spray, which ignited a fire in her apartment building. The fire spread and caused the death of a Chinese national woman in her 30s, who fell from a window during a failed escape attempt due to smoke blocking the stairway. The husband escaped by climbing to the next block, while the woman's attempt to escape was fatal. Eight other residents suffered smoke inhalation. Police are seeking an arrest warrant for the woman, accusing her of negligence. This incident highlights the dangers of viral social media trends promoting extreme pest control methods, such as flamethrowers, which can lead to real-life tragedies and loss of life.
title: South Korea: Woman trying to kill cockroach sets apartment block on fire
